page.title: 08EDUCATION AT STOKE ON TERN
page.content: {SCHOOL HISTORY (CONT) and that lasted until 1964 when children from the prison quarters made it necessary to have four teachers. This was because a prison was built not far away and the staff had houses built on site. {STOKE ON TERN 1870_1969 The school log books revealed that children had to sit on benches and share desks, about 8 children on a bench.In 1870 only 6 cases of punish- ment were recorded and that was for the cane: four of those were for tresspassing and doing damage on property adjoining the school. In 1888 an entry stated that the moral training would be HONESTY,MODESTY,TEMPERANCE, PRUDENCE AND PUNCTUALITY.Next in importance came reading, writing and arithmetic.
